Projects.title: Personal Portfolio Website
desc: This portfolio started as a heavily customized build based on an open-source React template. I rebuilt large sections of the layout, rewrote components, redesigned the visual style, and added new features such as project modals, mobile/desktop mockups, refined card layouts, improved spacing, and a cohesive color system. The goal was to create a lightweight, expressive personal site that highlights my work clearly and looks great on every device.

Projects.title: IPSS
desc: For IPSS, I collaborated with a professional designer who provided the layouts for the new site. My role was to implement the full build using WordPress and Elementor, create structured program pages, and develop private-access areas for enrolled students. I integrated a secure student portal for class materials, built custom application forms, and organized the overall information architecture to support multiple certification tracks. The result is a polished, modern site that meets the needs of both prospective and active students.

Projects.title: NJ Rise
desc: NJ Rise partnered with a professional designer to refresh their visual identity, and my role was to bring those designs to life in a functional, accessible, and mission-driven website. I translated the designerâ€™s layouts into a custom WordPress build using Elementor and implemented a WooCommerce-powered Virtual Pantry that allows donors to contribute by selecting specific items. I also improved content structure, created mobile-optimized templates, and ensured the site works seamlessly for donors, volunteers, and clients.

Projects.title: Lisa Bagwell - Assemblage Artist
desc: Lisa Bagwell's work involves intricate assemblage sculptures that deserved a cleaner, more expressive online presence. Her previous site was difficult to navigate and didn't showcase her artwork effectively. I redesigned the entire site using WordPress and Elementor, creating a bright, minimal layout that highlights her portfolio. I also improved the gallery structure, enhanced mobile responsiveness, and replaced outdated forms with Gravity Forms for a more reliable contact and inquiry experience.

Projects.title: Mount Tabor Historical Society
desc: The Mount Tabor Historical Society needed a modern, easy-to-navigate website that could showcase local history while supporting events, newsletters, tours, and volunteers. I rebuilt the entire site structure in WordPress using Elementor, reorganizing content, modernizing the layout, and creating a more intuitive user experience. A major feature is the fully interactive Walking Tour system powered by GeoDirectory, which supports both in-person and virtual visitors through unique stop pages, media galleries, and QR code signage located throughout the town.
